Similarly, ratio “0” indicates ratio particular camera trap event individuals numerator class. calf:cow ratio example, represent event one cows calves. example, female calf:male calf ratio plotted years locations example data:  also possible subset data include one camera trap locations /study years:  Several age/sex classes can combined plot ratios interest. example, next code chunk plots calf:(cow + calf) ratio. label ratio legend can changed default (“Ratio”), specific label, using ratio_name argument.
code: library(bisonpictools) bpt_plot_ratios(   event_data,   location_data,   numerator = "f0",   denominator = "m0" ) bpt_plot_ratios(   event_data,   location_data,   numerator = "f0",   denominator = "m0",   study_years = "2019-2020",   locations = c("LOCID1", "LOCID2") ) bpt_plot_ratios(   event_data,   location_data,   numerator = c("f0", "m0", "u0"),   denominator = c("fa"),   ratio_name = "calf:cow" )

previous_headings: Data Analysis > Using the RStudio Console
title: Getting Started with bisonpictools
text: uses bpt_analyse() function. Data checks completed analysis run ensure correct format. Informative error messages print console data follow required format. following arguments control number MCMC chains, number iterations, thinning rate model: "debug" used printing errors model sample (10 iterations 2 chains), "quick" used running quick run model demonstration purposes (10 iterations 2 chains), "report" default used full analysis (500 iterations 3 chains). nthin = 1L saves every sample; use "debug" "quick" modes, nthin = 10L saves every 10^{th} sample, detault; use "report" mode, increase nthin 5 model converge “report” mode. recommended : Run model analysis_mode = "quick" mode thinning rate nthin = 1L ensure model samples correctly. errors step 1, proceed running model analysis_mode = "report" thinning rate nthin = 10L, achieve convergence. Ensure table output model TRUE “converged” column. model converge, increase nthin 5, re-run model. errors step 1, proceed instead running model analysis_mode = "debug" thinning rate nthin = 1L print informative error messages.
code: # Start by running once on "quick" mode, with a thinning rate of 1 analysis <- bpt_analyse(   event_data = event_data,   location_data = location_data,   census_data = census_data,   proportion_calf_data = proportion_calf_data,   nthin = 1L,   analysis_mode = "quick" )  # If no errors appear, run the model on "report" mode, with a thinning rate of 10 analysis <- bpt_analyse(   event_data = event_data,   location_data = location_data,   census_data = census_data,   proportion_calf_data = proportion_calf_data,   nthin = 10L,   analysis_mode = "report" )  # If errors do appear, run the model on "debug" mode, which will provide # informative error messages analysis <- bpt_analyse(   event_data = event_data,   location_data = location_data,   census_data = census_data,   proportion_calf_data = proportion_calf_data,   nthin = 1L,   analysis_mode = "debug" )

title: Wood Bison Camera Trap Tools
text: goal bisonpictools facilitate visualization analysis camera trap data wood bison herds. package includes functions check correct formatting data, visualize data, manipulate analyse data using complex custom-built Bayesian model, generate predictions abundances, survival fecundity rates, population ratios. data analyzed using Bayesian Integrated Population Model, combines stage-structured population projection matrix model multiple sources data unified framework, allowing estimates age-sex class ratios, population vital rates, abundances, maintaining correct propagation uncertainty. See analytical methods vignette detail modeling approach.

title: Wood Bison Camera Trap Tools
text: bisonpictools one three packages bisonpic suite tools. bisonpictools shinybisonpic runbisonpic bisonpictools provides underlying visualization analysis functionality; shinybisonpic web-based Shiny app provides Graphical User Interface facilitate data visualization exploration, runbisonpic local-based Shiny app set run analysis.

title: Wood Bison Camera Trap Tools
text: Predictions total class-wise abundances, fecundity survival rates, several ratios interest derived posterior distribution estimated parameters. can visualized tables using functions bpt_predict prefix: predictions can plotted figure using bpt_plot_predictions() function.  predictions can plotted executing following code:
code: # E.g., Predict total abundance bpt_predict_abundance_total(analysis) #> # A tibble: 4 × 4 #>   annual    estimate lower upper #>   <fct>        <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 2018-2019     211.  182.  244. #> 2 2019-2020     225.  205.  252. #> 3 2020-2021     254.  230.  280. #> 4 2021-2022     295.  258.  311. # Can predict other values using the following functions bpt_predict_abundance_class(analysis) # Predicts abundance by class bpt_predict_survival(analysis) # Predicts survival rates bpt_predict_fecundity(analysis) # Predicts fecundity rate and proportion of reproductive cows bpt_predict_ratios(analysis) # Predicts population ratios # E.g., Plot predicted abundances by class bpt_plot_predictions(analysis, prediction = "abundance-class") # Plot total abundance bpt_plot_predictions(analysis, prediction = "abundance-total") # Plot survival rates bpt_plot_predictions(analysis, prediction = "survival") # Plot fecundity rates bpt_plot_predictions(analysis, prediction = "fecundity") # Plot ratios bpt_plot_predictions(analysis, prediction = "ratios")

title: Data checks based on the template — bpt_check_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # When all data sets are present data <- bpt_check_data(   event = event_data,   location = location_data,   census = census_data,   proportion_calf = proportion_calf_data,   complete = TRUE,   join = TRUE,   check_study_years = TRUE ) event_data <- data$event location_data <- data$location # To check only a single data set data_1 <- bpt_check_data(location = location_data) data_2 <- bpt_check_data(event = event_data) data_3 <- bpt_check_data(census = census_data) data_4 <- bpt_check_data(proportion_calf = proportion_calf_data) # Should error, as `complete = TRUE` requires all 4 data sets be provided try(event <- bpt_check_data(event = event_data, complete = TRUE)) } # }

what: Plot Ratios of Wood Bison Camera Events — bpt_plot_ratios
title: Plot Ratios of Wood Bison Camera Events — bpt_plot_ratios
text: Generates bubble plot ratio sex-age classes supplied numerator denominator. point represents event. size point represents total group size, colour point represents value ratio. Note ratio value "Inf" (infinity) indicates group particular camera trap event individuals denominator class. Similarly, ratio "0" indicates ratio particular camera trap event individuals numerator class.

title: Plot Ratios of Wood Bison Camera Events — bpt_plot_ratios
code: bpt_plot_ratios(   event_data,   location_data,   numerator,   denominator,   study_years = bpt_study_years(event_data),   locations = unique(location_data$location_id),   ratio_name = "Ratio" )

title: Plot Ratios of Wood Bison Camera Events — bpt_plot_ratios
text: event_data Tibble templated event data. location_data Tibble templated location data. numerator character vector sex-age codes go numerator ratio. denominator character vector sex-age codes go denominator ratio. study_years character vector study years include plot. locations character vector location_ids include plot. ratio_name alternate name label value ratio plot legend. Defaults "Ratio".

title: Plot Ratios of Wood Bison Camera Events — bpt_plot_ratios
text: ggplot object.

title: Parameters for functions — params
text: analysis Analysis object bpt_analyse(). event_data Tibble templated event data. location_data Tibble templated location data. census_data Tibble census data. proportion_calf_data Tibble proportion calf data. numerator character vector sex-age codes go numerator ratio. denominator character vector sex-age codes go denominator ratio. study_years character vector study years include plot. locations character vector location_ids include plot. analysis_mode Character string analysis mode, either "debug", "check", "report". nthin Thinning rate, takes default 10. levels_annual Levels annual factor data. census Integer vector census values. census_cv Numeric vector census coefficients variation. census_study_year Character vector census study years. census_day_of_year Integer vector census days year. proportion_calf Numeric vector proportion calf values. proportion_calf_cv Numeric vector proportion calf coefficients variation. proportion_calf_study_year Character vector proportion calf study years. proportion_calf_day_of_year Integer vector proportion calf days year. prediction One following: "abundance-class": plots abundances class study year. "abundance-total": plots total herd abundance study year. "survival": plots survival rates class study year (bull rate includes M2, M3, MA). "fecundity": plots fecundity rate proportion reproductive cows. "ratios": plots ratios study year.
